RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 1 1M Dirt CR: 80. Allowance Purse 25900. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR OHIO BRED OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 23 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances) (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ALWAYS LAUGHING reserved early through the first turn off the pace, slipped through on the rail entering the far turn to commence a rally, tipped out three wide at the head of the lane and drew off in the stretch as much best. LUCKY PENNY ROSE tracked the leaders from the fence down the backside, angled to the clear in upper stretch and kept on grinding down the lane to gain the place. LOFTY COWTOWN prompted the pace down the backstretch, rallied to the lead on the turn and was outkicked to the wire. KETTLE KISS rated in mid-pack to the far turn, responded mildly when called upon to make a steady advance through the stretch. COURTED trailed to the far turn and showed some late interest rallying up the rail in the stretch. SAVE THE FLAG raced near the rear of the field throughout and passed weakening rivals in the lane. ELIKA prominently placed for the run down the backside, rallied five wide in the turn to threaten and flattened out coming home. UNESCORTED raced wide all the way and never menaced. MY DANCING QUEEN showed speed setting the pace for the first half mile and stopped at the head of the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Always Laughing
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved early, snuck inside, tipped out, drew off, much best

ENTRY.NAME: Elika
ENTRY.COMMENT: prominent, early 5 wide bid, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Kettle Kiss
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated mid-pack, steady advance, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: Unescorted
ENTRY.OWNER: Mace Ed and Urieta's Racing Stable

ENTRY.NAME: My Dancing Queen
ENTRY.OWNER: Urieta's Racing Stable and BB Racing Stable

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 2 5F Dirt CR: 56. Maiden Special Weight Purse 24300. FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs. (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EL BAMBINO stalked the pace from the second flight two wide into the turn, circled four wide to rally turning for home and wore down the pacesetter in a determined drive. MEXITEXAFORNIA broke outward leaving the gate while speeding to the lead, shook off the pressure in the turn to open a clear advantage in upper stretch, finished willingly but could not hold off the winner. CUSSIN N FUSSIN tracked the leaders from the fence through the turn and kept on in the lane to hold the show as best of the rest. DIXIE MAN pressed the pace through the turn to the head of the lane and weakened coming home. M EIGHTY trailed to upper stretch and passed weaker rivals in the lane. ZHU DADDY went one-paced never posing a threat. MR. BLUTARSKY chased the pace for three-eighths and faded. THE RACE WAS HAND TIMED DUE TO MALFUNCTION WITH THE TIMING SYSTEM.

ENTRY.NAME: M Eighty
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, passed weaker, failed to menace

ENTRY.NAME: Cussin N Fussin
ENTRY.OWNER: Urieta's Racing Stable and Marchosky Ernest
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, held show, best of rest

ENTRY.NAME: Mexitexafornia
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke outward, speed, shook clear, couldn't hold

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 3 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 95. Starter Allowance Purse 17600. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS IN 2022 - 2023. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 23 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Conside red In Weight Allowances) (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FLIPPING FISH stalked the pace from three wide in the turn, made a bid in upper stretch to overtake the pacesetter, cleared off in mid-stretch and was geared down nearing the wire as a convincing winner. MON CAMO set a pressured pace to the head of the lane, responded when challenged in upper stretch and finished gamely to be second best. AUGER tracked the leaders through the turn and rallied mildly from five wide down the lane while failing to change leads. MASAI MAN pressed the pace from the fence through the turn and finished evenly. HAGLER trailed turning for home and split rivals down the stretch showing late interest. VENETIAN DREAM raced four wide throughout and failed to menace. GORMLEYS GOT GAME was never a threat. D'MONEY HONEY well placed in the early going and gave way in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Auger
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leaders, 5 wide stretch, mild bid, no lead change

ENTRY.NAME: Mon Camo
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace, responded, gamely, second best

ENTRY.NAME: Flipping Fish
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, bid 3 wide, cleared, geared down

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 50. Maiden Special Weight Purse 31800. FOR REGISTERED OHIO BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TOTAL SMOKESHOW set a pressured pace from the rail through the turn, shook clear in upper stretch and drew off to the wire as much best. SMARTASSET tracked the pacesetters from the a clear pocket through the turn, was set to an early drive and finished willingly to gain the place. WINDY VALLEY prompted the pace from three wide through out and kept on down the lane. DOMINUS O'S ME pressed the pace from between horses to duel on the lead to the head of the lane and was out-finished in the drive. STORMINATOR slow early to be at the rear of the main body of the field and made a mild rally down the lane. J. P INDY stumbled leaving the gate giving the field a five length head start, made a rally down the backside to get to contention into the turn and flattened out having lost all chance at the start. SHEZ IN A TIZZY chased from four wide through the turn and failed to mount a rally. CRYSTAL M was called upon into the turn while well off the pace and lacked a response.

ENTRY.NAME: Total Smokeshow
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace, shook clear, drew off, much best

ENTRY.NAME: Dominus O's Me
ENTRY.OWNER: Urieta Racing Stable and Quinteros Delia

ENTRY.NAME: Crystal M
ENTRY.COMMENT: dropped back, asked early, no response

ENTRY.NAME: Windy Valley
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted pace, 3 wide, bid, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: J. P Indy
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled start, middle move, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Smartasset
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked, pocket trip, long drive, willingly

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 60. Claiming Purse 19500. FOR REGISTERED OHIO BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 23 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MISS ELLIE bumped rival at the start, stalked the pace down the backside, took command turning for home and held on gamely. YOU NAME IT tracked the leaders to the turn rallied four wide on the bend and kept coming down the lane to just miss. MAYBE FRANKY squeezed between horses leaving the gate to lose position, gained ground down the backside to be prominent six wide at the head of the lane and was gaining late in a steady drive. CHILLVILLE rated in mid-pack to the top of the lane from the rail and showed late interest to be gaining late. BIRDIE'S CHANTZ broke inward squeezing rival at the start, dropped back to race near the rear and made a belated rally down the stretch. TWENTY FOUR KARAT set a pressured pace for the first half mile and weakened in the stretch. ARTIES CRYPTONITE bumped at the start by his inside rival, bobbled briefly causing him to lean outward into his outside rival, was caused to drop to the rear of the pack and showed late interest. TV TIZ GORGEOUS failed to menace. C MORE PRIDE was hung out wide throughout and never posed a threat. HOSANNA pressed the pace from between horses through the turn and tired. WAR MOON well placed along the fence in early contention and faded.

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Ellie
ENTRY.COMMENT: bump start, stalked pace, took command, held gamely

ENTRY.NAME: Arties Cryptonite
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, bobbled, trailed, late interest

ENTRY.NAME: Maybe Franky
ENTRY.COMMENT: squeezed start, bid 6 wide, steady drive, gaining

ENTRY.NAME: Birdie's Chantz
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke inward, bumped, dropped back, belatedly

ENTRY.NAME: C More Pride
ENTRY.OWNER: R and P Racing Stables, LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 14300. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 23 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,500 (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SKY stalked the pace down the backside, rallied four wide in the turn to gain on the pacesetter, engaged that one in mid-stretch and prevailed in the drive. ROSE KNOWS sped to the lead to open a clear advantage in the turn and could not hold on down the lane while clearly being second best. VAVITE tracked the pace from the fence and rallied up the rail to gain the show. SWEEPINJUSTICE slow early to trail the field and made a belated rally down the stretch. YOU'RE A DANDY rated in mid-pack just off the fence, tipped to the clear turning for home and made a mild bid in the lane. MY GIRL GABBY made a rally into the turn from four wide to mount an early bid and flattened out coming home. SOULSTONE went one-paced and never menaced. JUMP INTO SANITY was never a threat. LA SMOOCHIE broke alertly to be in front early, settled just off the pace and gave way in the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Vavite
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, rail rally, best o rest

ENTRY.NAME: Sky
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, 4 wide, steady advance, prevailed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 79. Allowance Purse 36200. FOR REGISTERED OHIO BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 23 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allow ances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: OKLAHOMA JOE prompted the pace from two wide through the turn, took command turning for home and drew off down the lane a clear winner. INTO GOLD set a pressured pace to the quarter pole, could not go with the winner but held on gamely for the place. PAINT THE TOWN slow early to trail the field, mounted a rally into the turn circling the field and ground his way to the show while continually gaining. HITE brushed his outside rival leaving the gate, was reserved in hand along the fence down the backside, cut the corner coming home and made a mild bid in the lane. K KID tracked the pace from the outside through the turn, made a bid in upper stretch and finished evenly. WETZEL raced near the rear of the field to the head of the stretch and passed weaker rivals in the lane. THE PINK Z stalked the pace through the turn to be prominent turning for home and weakened in the drive. CONDEMNATION well placed to be in striking distance in the turn and gave way in the stretch. CRYPTO COPY flashed brief speed for a quarter and dropped back as a non-factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Hite
ENTRY.COMMENT: brushed rival start, reserved, cut corner, rail bid

ENTRY.NAME: Wetzel
ENTRY.OWNER: Pickerrell William D Pickerrell Joe and Cline Robert C

ENTRY.NAME: K Kid
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace, bid upper, even late

ENTRY.NAME: Into Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace, gamely, held place

ENTRY.NAME: Oklahoma Joe
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted pace 2w, took command, drew off

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 8 6F Dirt CR: 59. Allowance Purse 33700. FOR REGISTERED OHIO BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 23 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Consider ed In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MARGARITA CINCO rushed up the fence to take the lead shortly from the gate, opened a clear advantage and kept the field safe having never been threatened in the lane. QUEENIE ROSE broke wide leaving the gate, stalked the pace down the backstretch, circled five wide in the turn to loom in upper stretch and failed to gain on the winner. FANTOOSH tracked the leader from just off the pace into the turn, was called upon early and finished willingly but unable to narrow the margin. DOMINIQUE'S NIGHT slow early to be near the rear of the pack, swung out in upper stretch and closed with a good belated rally. HERE COMES DOLLY saved ground cutting the corner turning for home to threaten in mid stretch and flattened out late in the drive. OH EYE SEE chased the leaders from three wide through the turn and failed to gain ground. PENNY'S TREASURE reserved off the pace along the rail and failed to mount a closing bid. STORM OF NINETEEN hustled from the gate to prompt the pace for a half mile and faded in the lane. EMERALD EYES was never a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Margarita Cinco
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed to lead, cleared, never threatened

ENTRY.NAME: Queenie Rose
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke wide, stalked pace, circled 5w, loomed, failed to gain
